intro: Hoffmannia teruae, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces clusters of violet or purple flowers that bloom throughout the year under optimal conditions. Its leaves are typically velvety and heart-shaped, often with a striking color contrast. Hoffmannia teruae is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
